speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Ron Volk  ## Nominated  AMERICAN CINEMA EDITORS (Eddie)

speaker: Best-Edited Half-Hour Series for Television
text: Ron Volk  * * *  ## Transcript {David Langley}     _Act 1  Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa_  _Fade in.  Roz is at a table, reading intently.  Frasier comes over with his coffee._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Roz. [_she doesn't respond_] I said hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_looks up_] Oh, sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't be.  I didn't mean to interrupt your reading.

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, I'm doing a little research.  I have a meeting with a publisher tomorrow.  I'm thinking of writing my own children's book.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, it's a story my mom made up for me when I was a little kid.  I tell it to Alice all the time now, and I thought it would be such a kick if I could get it published.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good for you, Roz!  You know, I dabbled in juvenile fiction myself.  Yes, Niles and I when we were boys wrote a series of stories together in which we were the heroes.  Along the lines of a "Hardy Boys" or a "Nancy Drew"...

speaker: Roz
text: "The Nancy Boys"?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  It was called "The Crane Boys Mysteries."  We were two plucky lads who used their keen psychological insights to solve crimes brought home by their detective father.

speaker: Roz
text: How many of these did you write?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thirty-four.  Let's see, there was "The Mystery of the One-Eared Monkey", "On Your Mark, Get Set, Die!"...

speaker: Frasier
text: And there was the one where our father was kidnapped and the only clue was a dented Ballantine can.

speaker: Niles
text: "The Suspicious Six Pack"!

speaker: Frasier
text: Excellent!  Niles, pull up a chair.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I will.  I can't stay long, though. [_to waitress_] Latte, to go, please. [_He sits._] I'm on the way to the spa to pick up Daphne.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that reminds me.  What time should I be at the apartment tonight?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, let's see.  It's an hour's trip to the spa, and there's a two hour graduation ceremony at the end of which they all throw their fat pants into the air... let's say seven o'clock.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, great.  I'll see you there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye, Roz.

speaker: Niles
text: Speaking of Daphne, I was hoping you could spare her this Friday.  I'm planning on taking her for a weekend getaway, where I think we may be taking our relationship to the next level.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God, Niles!  You're going to propose?

speaker: Niles
text: No, not that level, the level before that.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're going to ask her to move in with you?

speaker: Niles
text: One more level before that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're already dating...

speaker: Niles
text: No, that's two levels.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for heaven's sake, just tell me!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you know.  We're going to... consummate our relationship.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Well, uh... Gosh, it's none of my business, I just thought you'd already reached that level.

speaker: Niles
text: What made you think that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know.  I guess everybody just assumed...

speaker: Niles
text: Who's everybody?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nobody. But Niles, you have been on overnight trips together, haven't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  But they were all perfectly chaste.  Daphne wanted to wait until the time was right.  And well, we've both just been missing each other these past few weeks, I think the time is upon us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm so happy for you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, nobody's gonna believe you two haven't slept together.

speaker: Niles
text: Who's nobody?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nobody. _The waiter brings Niles his coffee.  Putting the cup down, he gives Niles a look and a little disbelieving shake of his head, then leaves. FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Niles' Mercedes  Fade in.  The back seat is full of balloons.  Niles is driving Daphne back to Frasier's._

speaker: Daphne
text: I love you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I love you too.  Oh, hey, I got you something.  _He reaches into the back seat and pulls out a gift bag he hands to her.  She pulls a red dress from it._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles.  It's lovely.  But I already have a dress like this.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.  That's it.  THAT'S the dress you wore five years ago when we danced the tango.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't understand.

speaker: Niles
text: It's for this weekend.  Only this time, instead of ending in heartache, the evening can end...in triumph.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's very romantic, but I'm not sure I can fit into it.  Not yet, anyway.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, nonsense.  You're as svelte as you ever were.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're sweet.  And it was cute when I came out of the spa and you pretended you couldn't see me.

speaker: Niles
text: Who said that?  Who's in my car?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you worked so hard, you stuck with it.  I'm proud of you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Actually, I'm proud of myself.  The staff therapist even complimented me on me willpower.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, so you did see a therapist?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's all part of the program, to help you find the cause of your overeating.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh-hmm.  Well, if you ask me, it's a classic case of sublimation, using substituting food for sex.  I recommend you see a certain doctor, I know very well.  He can help you.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's not what Gloria thinks.

speaker: Niles
text: Gloria?

speaker: Daphne
text: The therapist.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  My patients call me "Dr. Crane", but whatever... So, what does Gloria think?

speaker: Daphne
text: She thinks I may have gained the weight as a way to create distance between us.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, and why would you want to do that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, when you and I first came together, we agreed to wait a while before bringing the relationship into the bedroom. Then as time went on, you told me all these stories of how you pined for me for seven years.  How I'd been your unattainable dream.  How could anyone live up to that?  Gloria thinks I was terrified of letting you down, of not being perfect, so I ate. And ate.  And, apparently, ate.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, you couldn't possibly let me down.  And as for the weight, that didn't matter.  I never noticed.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's another thing, I gained sixty pounds.  Don't you think it's strange you couldn't see it?

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's not strange!  I love you.

speaker: Daphne
text: I love you too.  You know what Gloria says?

speaker: Niles
text: [_tense_] No.

speaker: Daphne
text: She says you couldn't see the extra weight because you were seeing the perfect me you've carried in your head for seven years.  She calls it "looking through love goggles".

speaker: Niles
text: All righty, let's get her on the phone, shall we?

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, don't.  I'm not trying to upset you, I'm just telling you what we discussed in therapy.

speaker: Niles
text: I understand, I understand.

speaker: Daphne
text: And I know how much you've been looking forward to this weekend, but I sort this out, I may need a little more time before I...

speaker: Niles
text: Say no more.  We can easily postpone the weekend.  Of course, if my theory is correct, and you ARE eating as a substitute for sex, then you're taking a terrible risk.

speaker: Daphne
text: I love you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I love you too.   **OF COURSE, EDDIE GETS TEN PERCENT OF THE ROYALTIES**   _Fade in.  There is a big banner in front of the balcony saying "Welcome Home, Daphne."  Roz and Martin are getting the place ready._

speaker: Martin
text: Roz, you know, if you really want to do a kid's book, you oughta write one about Eddie.  I'd buy one about Eddie.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks, but I already have an idea.  Besides, if I were gonna use a dog, I'd probably use about my own.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you wanna make your dog happy, or do you wanna sell books?  Now I was thinkin': Eddie joins the circus and he has all this clown makeup on and everything and juggles and stuff. And then you could do one where he invents this flying machine and has all these wacky adventures.

speaker: Roz
text: That's kinda cute.  He could join a flock of geese or he could become the world's first dog traffic reporter.

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie would never do that.  You really don't get Eddie, do you?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, look who's home!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!

speaker: Daphne
text: Is this all for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, God we missed you.

speaker: Roz
text: You look great, Daphne!

speaker: Martin
text: Great?  You look fantastic.  I don't know what they did to you there, but what a difference!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.  I was getting pretty big, wasn't I?

speaker: Martin
text: Big?  You were gi-normous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: I was just tellin' her how big she was.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come here old man.

speaker: Frasier
text: You really do look lovely, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you Dr. Crane.  But I still have to be careful what I eat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, of course.  And to that end, actually, I have a little surprise for you in the fridge.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you didn't have to do that.  It's not some of those low cal dinners, is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just go look.  _She goes into the kitchen.  There is the sound of a pig squealing. Frasier and Martin begin laughing, Roz looks disgusted.  Daphne comes back in, laughing_

speaker: Daphne
text: That's hysterical.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's called the "Refrigerator Pig".  It's this little plastic pig, he's got a recording in its belly, every time you open the refrigerator door, you'll hear his scolding squeal.

speaker: Roz
text: So Daphne, tell us about the spa.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it was lots of hard work.  We had hikes every morning and sessions with a personal trainer.

speaker: Niles
text: And a wonderful therapist. [_to Frasier_] You're going to love this.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, there was a professional therapist on staff.

speaker: Niles
text: Named "Gloria."

speaker: Daphne
text: Who helped me dig down to the root of my problems.

speaker: Niles
text: Gloria's very handy with a shovel.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she must have been very good.  I mean, obviously, look at you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.  Gloria's very empathetic, because she had a similar weight problem.  Only she didn't have anyone to help her deal with it.  She had to battle it herself for years.

speaker: Niles
text: She didn't have a boyfriend she could blame?

speaker: Daphne
text: Is there something you want to say to me?

speaker: Niles
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I've got something to say.  I would like to propose a toast.

speaker: Daphne
text: I was very lucky to have someone like Gloria at the spa.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, usually you have to go all the way to a hair salon for that kind of insight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Daphne, the important thing is that you're feeling better and that your back home, where you belong.

speaker: Daphne
text: I better make mine water.  Champagne is pure sugar, you know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what the hell is wrong with you?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier, you would not believe the hack psychobabble this woman has filled Daphne's head with.

speaker: Martin
text: Well still, that's no reason to be acting like an ass. So you just shape up and treat Daphne with respect!  _There is the sound of the Refrigerator Pig from the kitchen.  Then there are crunching noises and Daphne can be seen jumping up and down. She comes back in._

speaker: Daphne
text: Apparently that pig of yours can dish it out but he can't take it.  So, how 'bout that toast?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, good idea.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  To Daphne, your warmth and spirit have helped make this place a home.  Your influence can be seen in a thousand different ways.

speaker: Niles
text: Unless, of course, one's wearing his love goggles.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's it.  Niles, I think you should go.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: I want you to leave.  Right now.  _Niles looks put upon, then sets his glass down and leaves.  Daphne sets the water down and heads to her room, Roz hurries after her. Martin and Frasier look at each other nervously._

speaker: Martin
text: Nice call on the "Refrigerator Pig".  _FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Niles' Office  Fade in.  Niles is talking to a patient and looking through his Rolodex._

speaker: Patient
text: So, you don't think I have a germ phobia?

speaker: Niles
text: Not at all, just a healthy sense of personal hygiene. [_Niles hands him a card._] Ah, here's the number of the man who cleans my telephone.  The best in Seattle.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't touch.  There you go. _Niles opens the door for him.  Frasier is leaning against the doorframe._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.  What are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I just wanted to see how you're doing after last night. Daphne caught me up on what's been going on.

speaker: Niles
text: Wonderful.  So she's talking to every therapist under the sun but me.

speaker: Frasier
text: She said she tried to talk to you.

speaker: Niles
text: No.  She tried to blame me.  According to her puppet master Gloria, Daphne overate because she was afraid that she couldn't live up to my image of her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there may be something to that.  She does have seven years of fantasy to live up to.

speaker: Niles
text: What fantasy?  I have a very realistic picture of Daphne. I love her for who she is, I have since the very beginning.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  When exactly was "the very beginning" for the two of you, anyway?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, don't you remember?  You introduced us. _CUT TO:  The scene cuts to their first meeting, from[[1.03]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_3/dinner_at_eight.html "Dinner At Eight"), "Dinner at Eight." _

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?  This is my brother Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You're Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Why, yes I am!  _As he moves across to shake her hand, we see that present-day Niles and Frasier are observing the memory in the background._

speaker: Niles
text: When Frasier told me he hired an Englishwoman, I pictured someone a little more... not quite so... you're Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Right again.  It's very nice to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look at you, Niles.  The woman's a stranger to you and yet you're ready to hand her your heart.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I may have been a tad smitten.  What's your point?

speaker: Frasier
text: My point is... Niles, pay attention!  My point is your so-called realistic picture of Daphne has been clouded from the start by your intense attraction to her.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  Perhaps at the beginning I was blinded by infatuation.  But over the years, I've learned everything about her.  And my love has only deepened.  I've learned that she is caring and, and compassionate.  And she can be moody, sometimes.  She likes jelly on her pancakes, instead of syrup.  Uh, her laugh is like music.  Oh, and that girl can dance! _CUT TO:  The scene cuts to the Snow Ball from[[3.13]](/frasier/transcripts/season_3/episode_13/moon_dance.html "Moon Dance") "Moon Dance," as Daphne and Niles dance the tango._

speaker: Niles
text: You're beautiful!  You're a goddess!

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't ever want this moment to end!

speaker: Niles
text: Then let's not let it!

speaker: Niles
text: This is one of my favorite memories.  See, that's the dress I wanted her to wear this weekend.  Isn't she spectacular?

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed she is.

speaker: Niles
text: She's perfect!  Oh, oh, wait!  Look at this.  Watch.

speaker: Niles
text: [_smiling_] I come here often.

speaker: Frasier
text: I suspect part of you has never left.

speaker: Niles
text: Can you blame me?  Look at us!  We're magnificent together. We're moving in perfect synch.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's that word "perfect" again.

speaker: Niles
text: I know what you're thinking.  Just because this evening was perfect doesn't mean I'm idealizing Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, did you hear yourself out there?  You called her "a goddess".  You can't build a higher pedestal than that. Who could possibly compete with that sort of image?  _The dance ends and everyone, the present Niles and Frasier included, applaud._

speaker: Niles
text: That's not fair.  I'm well aware that's just one side of her. I'm also acquainted with her ordinary, domestic, everyday side. _CUT TO:  The scene cuts to Niles and Daphne in the kitchen of his apartment from[[5.20]](/frasier/transcripts/season_5/episode_20/first_date.html "First Date") "First Date," chopping vegetables.  Present-day Niles and Frasier are there, watching._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_in time with the chopping_] Doomp-da, doomp-da, doomp-da, doomp-da.

speaker: Niles
text: Hear and soul, I fell in love with you... Heart and soul, the way a fool would do...

speaker: Both
text: Madly!  Because you held me tight And stole a kiss in the night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please!

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Even your everyday memories are idealized.  How long until the cartoon blue bird lands on her shoulder?

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  So maybe my memories of Daphne are perfect.  Has it ever occurred to you that maybe Daphne just IS perfect?

speaker: Niles
text: I held you tight, It served you right, I stole a kiss... in the night.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's it.  I'm going home.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, wait.  How come?

speaker: Frasier
text: I've nothing else to say.  Niles, I love you.  And I love Daphne.  I just hope the two of you can work this thing out together.

speaker: Niles
text: No, wait, don't go, don't go.  Help me understand, why is everyone acting like I've done something wrong?  The only thing I am guilty is loving Daphne, and that's all I've ever done.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Yes, and how did you love her?  From afar.  You were never in love WITH her, you were in love AT her.  Now, you've been given a chance to experience her in a real relationship and yet for some reason, you're resisting it.  Rather than see her as she really is, you keep holding on to the memory.

speaker: Niles
text: No, that's not true.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, the woman gained sixty pounds, and everyone in the world saw it but you.  All you ever saw was a perfect woman in a red dress. _A long pause.  Niles takes a deep breath and leans back against his desk._

speaker: Niles
text: Okay.  If you're right - and that's a big "if" - why would I do that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe Daphne's not the only one who's afraid she won't measure up.  Maybe you're afraid too.  After all, if it turns out she's not perfect, then there's a chance things won't work out.  Then not only will you lose Daphne, but you'll have wasted the last seven years of your life chasing an illusion.    _Fade in.  Martin is sitting in his chair.  Frasier opens the front door, Roz is there._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz.  What a pleasant surprise.

speaker: Roz
text: [_coming in_] Break out the champagne!  I just sold my children's book.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, that's great!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, congratulations, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks!  You know, this young editor, he's like twenty-three years old, his name's Scott.  And I figure he'll just be into action figures and video games and there I was with this simple little story, but he loved it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great, congratulations.  I've been saving a very special bottle for just such an occasion.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, while you're in there, get my very special can.

speaker: Roz
text: I gotta call my mother, she is gonna get such a kick out of this.  Mom?  Hey!  Remember that story you used to tell me when I was a kid?  You know, it was about the little girl and her grandfather?  Yeah, well, I just got it published.  What? Well you never told me that!  Okay fine, just forget I called. Yeah, bye.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you can put that away.

speaker: Martin
text: What happened?

speaker: Roz
text: Apparently I just sold my publisher... "Heidi"?  I better get over there and let him know before he...

speaker: Roz
text: Hello?  Oh, hello Scott.  I know, I just heard.  Weird, huh?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, tell him about Eddie! [_flaps his arms_]

speaker: Roz
text: I'm so sorry.  It was a movie too?

speaker: Roz
text: Hey.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.  Hi, Dad.

speaker: Both
text: Hi, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, what do you say we head out for dinner at the steakhouse?

speaker: Martin
text: The steakhouse?  Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell.  The blood's been flyin' through my arteries lately.

speaker: Martin
text: Just give me a minute to get ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne?  I want to apologize for the other night.  I was rude, and disrespectful, and I'm sorry I hurt you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Apology accepted.  Oh, come here.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I was just about to make myself some dinner.  Would you like to join me?

speaker: Niles
text: I would love that!

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, wait, Daphne?  I'm going to pass on dinner.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's no trouble.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I know that, it's just that...I don't really care for your cooking.

speaker: Daphne
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you're not the best cook in the world.  In fact, you're not very good at cooking.  At all.  Bad, BAD cook!

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell is he doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh... Well, we're off.

speaker: Martin
text: God bless you, son!

speaker: Niles
text: You okay?

speaker: Daphne
text: How could I be, after that horrible thing you just said to me?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm sorry, darling.  I just want to show you I see you the way you really are.

speaker: Daphne
text: And who I am is a bad cook, is that what you're saying?

speaker: Niles
text: No, that's not fair.  I, I thought this was what you wanted.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well it still hurts.  I have got my feelings, you know. I thought you loved my cooking.  Well, you certainly could have handled this better.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, then... I don't know what you want!  I can't read minds, you know!  And by the way, neither can you!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_gapes_] Are you saying you don't think I'm psychic?!

speaker: Niles
text: Not if you thought I loved your cooking!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm sorry it's not that hoity-toity crap you eat!

speaker: Niles
text: What does that mean?  You, you think I'm pretentious?

speaker: Daphne
text: Huh, you'd eat a worm if I gave it a French name!

speaker: Niles
text: Well fine!  If that's the way you feel, maybe I'll just have dinner by myself!

speaker: Daphne
text: Fine!  It'll spare you the hell that's my cooking!  _Niles storms out and Daphne heads for her room.  Before she can get there, she turns back just as Niles hurries back through the door._

speaker: Niles
text: I am so sorry!  I love you so much!

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't mean any of those things.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes you did.  And I did too.  You're a pretentious snob with your wine and your opera.

speaker: Niles
text: Well...you NEVER GIVE OPERA A CHANCE!  You're too judgmental.

speaker: Daphne
text: And you're a clean freak.

speaker: Niles
text: Well...I hate your unicorn collection.

speaker: Daphne
text: And I hate that your closet is bigger than mine!

speaker: Niles
text: Well...you're too tall!

speaker: Daphne
text: You're too short.

speaker: Niles
text: Well...  _They kiss passionately, stumbling up against the pillar and knocking over one of Frasier's statuettes.  The camera continues to pan across as they continue._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles...   _Niles is sitting at a table, holding a cup, with a happy little smile on his face.  Frasier comes in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, there you are, Niles. [_to waiter_] May I have a latte, please? [_he sits_] So, how are things with you and Daphne?  _Niles doesn't say anything and continues to stare with his faraway look.  The waiter hands Frasier his cup._

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Niles, is everything okay? _Niles slowly blinks and, without turning his head, shifts his eyes to look at Frasier, smiling all the while._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Niles
text: You know the best part, Frasier?  It wasn't at all like I imagined it.
